III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities;
Section seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Description Rule 162. (1) An agency must establish a process improvement
and a seclusion reduction/elimination plan that addresses the
1

following areas: (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective
November 1, 2022.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1: Youth are being locked in their rooms when they
are in trouble.
Allegation 2: Agency staff are locking youth in the bedrooms at
night, resulting in seclusion of youth.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
On 12/04/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Compliance. He was advised of the allegations of the
investigation. He denied that youth are secluded in their
bedrooms as a form of discipline.
On 12/04/2024 in-person interviews were completed with Youth
B, Youth C, Youth E and Youth D at Vista Maria. They denied
being locked in their room as a form of discipline and denied
having knowledge of any other youth being locked in their room as
a form of discipline.
On 12/04/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at
Vista Maria. She denied being locked in her room as a form of
discipline and denied having knowledge of any other youth being
locked in their room as a form of discipline. She indicated the
youth have been asked to remain in their bedroom by law
enforcement if they are on site and are trying to get the unit under
control.
On 12/10/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant to
return call with any additional information regarding concerns at
Vista Maria.
On 12/10/2024 a voicemail message was left for Foster Care
Worker (FCW) to return call and advise of any concerns with
placement of Youth A at Vista Maria.
On 12/12/2024 a video conference was held. Area manager,
Manager 1, Manager 2 and Manager 3 participated. Agency staff
confirmed that youth were being secluded in their bedrooms at
night. Policy Clarification of the rule was provided to agency
regarding seclusion and how securing bedrooms at night is in
violation of that rule. The agency indicated their intention to
2

submit a plan on their process to come into compliance with
policy.
On 12/17/2024 in-person interviews were completed with Youth
F, Youth D and Youth G at Vista Maria. Youth F and Youth G
denied being locked in their room as a form of discipline and
denied having knowledge of any other youth being locked in their
room as a form of discipline. All three youth confirmed that the
bedroom doors are locked when they are in their rooms for the
night to sleep. They reported that they are required to knock on
the door if they need to exit to use the restroom or for any other
needs.
Allegation 2:
Interviews:
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Compliance at Vista Maria. He confirmed that bedroom doors
are secure at night in Beata, Freedom and Rose Hall.
On 12/17/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1.
She confirmed that bedroom doors are secure at night when youth
go to bed.
On 01/08/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth A.
She confirmed that bedroom doors are still being locked at night.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Prohibited Physical
Intervention Practices include but are not to: • Seclusion (secured
or by verbal directive) preventing a client’s egress from the
designated area will not be utilized.
Vista Maria Sleeping Room Hour Policy – Policy indicates in
order to meet the standards of Public Act 116 (PA 116) and
provide all residents with appropriate healthy sleeping habits,
Vista Maria has set hours for sleeping that shall not exceed the
resident being in their bedrooms more than 8 hours for sleeping.
Residents may request to stay in their rooms longer, but should
not be required. Residents are to observe sleeping hours between
the following hours of 11pm -7am. During which time the bedroom
doors are to be secured.
Email Documentation - The agency provided documentation
from a prior consultant that advised that the agency could, for the
purposes of safety, continue to lock the bedrooms of youth during
sleeping hours.
3

Agency Compliance Plan – A plan was submitted by Vista
administration that indicated bedrooms would be unlocked during
sleeping hours by 1/31/25.
Tour of Facility:
A tour of the facility bedroom area was completed on 12/17/2024.
Some bedroom doors of youth bedrooms were found to be
unsecure and other were found to be secured. At the time of the
tour, youth were not in their bedrooms. No other areas of concern
were noted.
Analysis Allegation 1:
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and denied that youth are secluded in their bedroom
as a form of discipline.
Allegation 2:
At the conclusion of the investigation, it was determined that the
agency was locking the doors of the bedrooms of the youth during
sleeping hours. Although seclusion is prohibited by the rule, the
agency will not be found in non-compliance based on incorrect
consultation provided previously.
Technical Assistance
Agency was informed they are required to eliminate the use of
seclusion during sleeping hours.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
